topic_metadata.title: How to add text and symbol to subscript?

posts.name: Nhan
posts.cooked:
This is what I expected

image344×158 58.5 KB

I have tried $succ#sub[W(succ#sub['])]$ but this is what I got
. I have to use sub because _ makes the notation incorrect. So what is the way to subscript text with symbols and texts included.

Thanks.
posts.raw:
This is what I expected
![image|344x158](upload://nZ7kjkF0t2BYNOh9QNHK5bDX9m6.png)

I have tried `$succ#sub[W(succ#sub['])]$` but this is what I got 
![image|132x46](upload://oCqgsXwBlqFJuHcQYnj3GmHgF4b.png). I have to use `sub` because `_` makes the notation incorrect. So what is the way to subscript text with symbols and texts included.

Thanks.

posts.cooked:
Does this achieve what you are looking for?

$succ#sub[$W([succ'])$]$

The change was to surround everything within sub[] with $$ so that it is interpreted as math. Calling #sub switches from math mode to content mode so you need to switch back to math.

To get the W closer to the initial succ symbol, you can add a 0pt horizontal distance:

$succ#h(0pt)#sub[$W([succ'])$]$
posts.raw:
Does this achieve what you are looking for?
```
$succ#sub[$W([succ'])$]$
```
![image|194x72](upload://5EGLMCgsSdYr9zQE2yV8RggqYgU.png)

The change was to surround everything within `sub[]` with `$$` so that it is interpreted as math.  Calling `#sub` switches from math mode to content mode so you need to switch back to math.

To get the W closer to the initial succ symbol, you can add a `0pt` horizontal distance:
```
$succ#h(0pt)#sub[$W([succ'])$]$
```

posts.name: Nhan
posts.cooked: Oh nice. That’s what I’m looking for. Thank you!
posts.raw: Oh nice. That's what I'm looking for. Thank you!

posts.name: sjfhsjfh
posts.cooked:
Try this(for single use)

$ attach(succ, br: W([succ'])) $

If you’d like all your succ operators to be like that, then you can redefine the text operator:

// It seems that the default succ definition has limits: true
#let succ = math.op(sym.succ, limits: false)

$ succ_(W([succ'])) $
posts.raw:
Try this(for single use)

```typ
$ attach(succ, br: W([succ'])) $
```

If you’d like all your `succ` operators to be like that, then you can redefine the text operator:

```typ
// It seems that the default succ definition has limits: true
#let succ = math.op(sym.succ, limits: false)

$ succ_(W([succ'])) $
```

posts.cooked:
Removing limits is nice. The in-between solution is

#let sub = sub
$succ sub(W([succ'])).$

#let nosp = h(0pt)
$succ nosp sub(W([succ'])).$

image208×182 7.1 KB
posts.raw:
Removing limits is nice. The in-between solution is

```typ
#let sub = sub
$succ sub(W([succ'])).$

#let nosp = h(0pt)
$succ nosp sub(W([succ'])).$
```

![image|208x182, 75%](upload://pYuvPRUfOXUGR1fenUDsRmMxuQs.png)
